problem_description:
Global problem:
    This problem involves a collection of items, where each have a value and a weight. We have different items given in the parameters.
    We have a infinite number of boxes with width BOX_WIDTH and height BOX_HEIGHT. All items need to be packed into minimal number of such boxes.
    The result and expected output is:
        - the assigment of each item into a box
        - the position (x and y) of each item within its assigned box. x and y have minimum values 0 and maximum infinity.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 1:
    The items that are put into a box, must fit exactly inside the box and must not stick out of the box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 2:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, they must not overlap.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 3:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, one item can be exactly in one box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

constants.description: List of items to be placed in the box

decision_variables.description: Number of boxes used to pack all items, minimized as objective
Assignment of each item to a box with box id and position
X and Y positions of each item within its assigned box

constraints:
# -- Constraints --


# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def items_fit_exactly_in_box(
    items: DSList(length=10, elem_type=Item),
    assignments: DSList(length=10, elem_type=BoxAssignment),
    box_width: int,
    box_height: int
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        # Ensure item fits within the box dimensions
        assert assignments[i].x + items[i].width <= box_width
        assert assignments[i].y + items[i].height <= box_height
        # Ensure item is placed within valid box coordinates
        assert assignments[i].x >= 0
        assert assignments[i].y >= 0

items_fit_exactly_in_box(ITEMS, item_box_assignments, BOX_WIDTH, BOX_HEIGHT)

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def no_overlap(
    items: DSList(length=10, elem_type=Item),
    assignments: DSList(length=10, elem_type=BoxAssignment)
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            # Only check overlap if both items are in the same box
            if assignments[i].box_id == assignments[j].box_id:
                # Check if rectangles (items) overlap
                assert (
                    assignments[i].x + items[i].width <= assignments[j].x or
                    assignments[j].x + items[j].width <= assignments[i].x or
                    assignments[i].y + items[i].height <= assignments[j].y or
                    assignments[j].y + items[j].height <= assignments[i].y
                )

no_overlap(ITEMS, item_box_assignments)

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def ensure_item_in_one_box(
    assignments: DSList(length=10, elem_type=BoxAssignment)
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        # Ensure each item is assigned to exactly one box
        assert assignments[i].box_id >= 1
        assert assignments[i].box_id <= 10

ensure_item_in_one_box(item_box_assignments)
full_formulation:
# --- Objects ---


Item = DSRecord({
    "width": DSInt(lb=1, ub=20),
    "height": DSInt(lb=1, ub=5)
})

BoxAssignment = DSRecord({
    "box_id": DSInt(lb=1, ub=10),
    "x": DSInt(lb=0, ub=20),
    "y": DSInt(lb=0, ub=5)
})



# --- Constants and Decision Variables ---
BOX_HEIGHT : int = 5
BOX_WIDTH : int = 20
ITEMS : DSList(length=10, elem_type=Item) = [
    {"width": 6, "height": 5},
    {"width": 8, "height": 5},
    {"width": 6, "height": 3},
    {"width": 13, "height": 5},
    {"width": 14, "height": 2},
    {"width": 12, "height": 4},
    {"width": 17, "height": 5},
    {"width": 9, "height": 4},
    {"width": 16, "height": 3},
    {"width": 11, "height": 3}
]
N_ITEMS : int = 10
nr_used_boxes: DSInt(lb=1, ub=10)
item_box_assignments: DSList(length=10, elem_type=BoxAssignment)
x_y_positions: DSList(length=10, elem_type=BoxAssignment)
N_ITEMS : int = 10
N_ITEM_BOX_ASSIGNMENTS : int = 10
N_X_Y_POSITIONS : int = 10


# --- objective ---
def calculate_objective(assignments: DSList(length=10, elem_type=BoxAssignment)) -> DSInt(lb=1, ub=10):
    max_box_id: int = 0
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        if assignments[i].box_id > max_box_id:
            max_box_id = assignments[i].box_id
    return max_box_id

objective = calculate_objective(item_box_assignments)
nr_used_boxes = objective
minimize(objective)

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def items_fit_exactly_in_boxes(
    items: DSList(length=10, elem_type=Item),
    assignments: DSList(length=10, elem_type=BoxAssignment)
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        item_width: int = items[i].width
        item_height: int = items[i].height
        x_pos: int = assignments[i].x
        y_pos: int = assignments[i].y
        box_id: int = assignments[i].box_id
        
        # Ensure item fits within box dimensions
        assert x_pos + item_width <= BOX_WIDTH
        assert y_pos + item_height <= BOX_HEIGHT
        
        # Ensure item is placed within valid coordinates
        assert x_pos >= 0
        assert y_pos >= 0

items_fit_exactly_in_boxes(ITEMS, item_box_assignments)

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def no_overlap_in_boxes(
    assignments: DSList(length=10, elem_type=BoxAssignment),
    items: DSList(length=10, elem_type=Item)
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            # Only check items in the same box
            if assignments[i].box_id == assignments[j].box_id:
                x1: int = assignments[i].x
                y1: int = assignments[i].y
                w1: int = items[i].width
                h1: int = items[i].height
                
                x2: int = assignments[j].x
                y2: int = assignments[j].y
                w2: int = items[j].width
                h2: int = items[j].height
                
                # Check for non-overlapping: either one is to the left, right, above or below the other
                assert (x1 + w1 <= x2) or (x2 + w2 <= x1) or (y1 + h1 <= y2) or (y2 + h2 <= y1)

no_overlap_in_boxes(item_box_assignments, ITEMS)

):

        assert box_id >= 1
        assert box_id <= 10

ensure_item_assigned_to_single_box(item_box_assignments)

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.

def items_fit_exactly_in_boxes(
    items: DSList(length=10, elem_type=Item),
    assignments: DSList(length=10, elem_type=BoxAssignment),
    box_width: int,
    box_height: int
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        item_width: int = items[i].width
        item_height: int = items[i].height
        x_pos: int = assignments[i].x
        y_pos: int = assignments[i].y

        # Ensure item fits within the box dimensions
        assert x_pos + item_width <= box_width
        assert y_pos + item_height <= box_height

        # Ensure item positions are non-negative
        assert x_pos >= 0
        assert y_pos >= 0

items_fit_exactly_in_boxes(ITEMS, item_box_assignments, BOX_WIDTH, BOX_HEIGHT)

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def no_overlap_between_items(
    items: DSList(length=10, elem_type=Item),
    assignments: DSList(length=10, elem_type=BoxAssignment)
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            # Only check overlap if both items are in the same box
            if assignments[i].box_id == assignments[j].box_id:
                # Extract values for clarity and compliance
                x1: int = assignments[i].x
                y1: int = assignments[i].y
                w1: int = items[i].width
                h1: int = items[i].height

                x2: int = assignments[j].x
                y2: int = assignments[j].y
                w2: int = items[j].width
                h2: int = items[j].height

                # No overlap condition: one of the following must be true
                # 1. item1 is to the left of item2
                # 2. item1 is to the right of item2

problem_description:
Global problem:
    This problem involves a collection of items, where each have a value and a weight. We have different items given in the parameters.
    We have a infinite number of boxes with width BOX_WIDTH and height BOX_HEIGHT. All items need to be packed into minimal number of such boxes.
    The result and expected output is:
        - the assigment of each item into a box
        - the position (x and y) of each item within its assigned box. x and y have minimum values 0 and maximum infinity.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 1:
    The items that are put into a box, must fit exactly inside the box and must not stick out of the box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 2:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, they must not overlap.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 3:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, one item can be exactly in one box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

constants.description: List of items to be placed in the box

decision_variables.description: Number of boxes used in the end to pack all all items. Minimizing it is the objective.
Which item is assigned to which box.
Position x and y of each item within box

) -> None:

        assert assignments[i].x + items[i].width <= BOX_WIDTH
        assert assignments[i].y + items[i].height <= BOX_HEIGHT

        # Ensure item is placed within valid box coordinates
        assert assignments[i].x >= 0
        assert assignments[i].y >= 0

                x_not_overlap: bool = (assignments[i].x + items[i].width <= assignments[j].x) or \
                                      (assignments[j].x + items[j].width <= assignments[i].x)

                                      (assignments[j].y + items[j].height <= assignments[i].y)
                # Assert that at least one axis does not overlap
                assert x_not_overlap or y_not_overlap

    "height": DSInt(lb=1, ub=5)
})

BoxAssignment = DSRecord({
    "box_id": DSInt(lb=1, ub=10),
    "x": DSInt(lb=0, ub=20),
    "y": DSInt(lb=0, ub=5)
})



# --- Constants and Decision Variables ---
BOX_HEIGHT: int = 5
BOX_WIDTH: int = 20
ITEMS: DSList(length=10, elem_type=Item) = [
    {"width": 6, "height": 5},
    {"width": 8, "height": 5},
    {"width": 6, "height": 3},
    {"width": 13, "height": 5},
    {"width": 14, "height": 2},
    {"width": 12, "height": 4},
    {"width": 17, "height": 5},
    {"width": 9, "height": 4},
    {"width": 16, "height": 3},
    {"width": 11, "height": 3}
]
N_ITEMS: int = 10
nr_used_boxes: DSInt(lb=0, ub=10)
item_box_assignments: DSList(length=10, elem_type=BoxAssignment)
x_y_positions: DSList(length=10, elem_type=BoxAssignment)
N_ITEMS : int = 10
N_ITEM_BOX_ASSIGNMENTS : int = 10
N_X_Y_POSITIONS : int = 10


# --- objective ---
def calculate_objective(assignments: DSList(length=10, elem_type=BoxAssignment)) -> DSInt(lb=0, ub=10):
    max_box_id: int = 0
    for i in range(1, N_ITEM_BOX_ASSIGNMENTS + 1):
        box_id: int = assignments[i].box_id
        if box_id > max_box_id:
            max_box_id = box_id
    return max_box_id

objective = calculate_objective(item_box_assignments)
nr_used_boxes = objective
minimize(objective)

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def items_fit_exactly_in_boxes(
    items: DSList(length=10, elem_type=Item),
    assignments: DSList(length=10, elem_type=BoxAssignment),
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        item_width: int = items[i].width
        item_height: int = items[i].height
        pos: BoxAssignment = assignments[i]
        x_pos: int = pos.x
        y_pos: int = pos.y
        box_id: int = pos.box_id
        
        # Ensure item fits within box dimensions
        assert x_pos + item_width <= BOX_WIDTH
        assert y_pos + item_height <= BOX_HEIGHT
        assert x_pos >= 0
        assert y_pos >= 0
        assert box_id >= 1
        assert box_id <= 10

items_fit_exactly_in_boxes(ITEMS, item_box_assignments)

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def no_overlap_constraints(
    assignments: DSList(length=10, elem_type=BoxAssignment),
    items: DSList(length=10, elem_type=Item)
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            # Get assignment and item details
            pos_i: BoxAssignment = assignments[i]
            pos_j: BoxAssignment = assignments[j]
            
            item_i: Item = items[i]
            item_j: Item = items[j]
            
            # Only check overlap if both items are in the same box
            if pos_i.box_id == pos_j.box_id:
                # Overlap condition: rectangles overlap if neither is completely to the left, right, above, or below the other
                assert (
                    pos_i.x + item_i.width <= pos_j.x or
                    pos_j.x + item_j.width <= pos_i.x or
                    pos_i.y + item_i.height <= pos_j.y or
                    pos_j.y + item_j.height <= pos_i.y
                )

no_overlap_constraints(item_box_assignments, ITEMS)

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def ensure_item_assignment_to_single_box(
    assignments: DSList(length=10, elem_type=BoxAssignment)
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        box_id: int = assignments[i].box_id
        assert box_id >= 1
        assert box_id <= 10

ensure_item_assignment_to_single_box(item_box_assignments)

problem_description:
Global problem:
    This problem involves a collection of items, where each have a value and a weight. We have different items given in the parameters.
    We have a infinite number of boxes with width BOX_WIDTH and height BOX_HEIGHT. All items need to be packed into minimal number of such boxes.
    The result and expected output is:
        - the assigment of each item into a box
        - the position (x and y) of each item within its assigned box. x and y have minimum values 0 and maximum infinity.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 1:
    The items that are put into a box, must fit exactly inside the box and must not stick out of the box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 2:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, they must not overlap.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 3:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, one item can be exactly in one box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

constants.description: List of items to be placed in the box

decision_variables.description: Number of boxes used in the end to pack all all items. Minimizing it is the objective.
Which item is assigned to which box.
Position x and y of each item within box

        box_id: int = assignments[i].box_id
        if box_id > max_box_id:
            max_box_id = box_id
    return max_box_id

objective = calculate_objective(item_box_assignments)
nr_used_boxes = objective
minimize(objective)

                    assignments[j].y + items[j].height <= assignments[i].y

                assert x_not_overlapping or y_not_overlapping

        assert assignments[i].box_id <= 10

problem_description:
Global problem:
    This problem involves a collection of items, where each have a value and a weight. We have different items given in the parameters.
    We have a infinite number of boxes with width BOX_WIDTH and height BOX_HEIGHT. All items need to be packed into minimal number of such boxes.
    The result and expected output is:
        - the assigment of each item into a box
        - the position (x and y) of each item within its assigned box. x and y have minimum values 0 and maximum infinity.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 1:
    The items that are put into a box, must fit exactly inside the box and must not stick out of the box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 2:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, they must not overlap.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 3:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, one item can be exactly in one box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

        assert assignments[i].y >= 0
        assert assignments[i].x + items[i].width <= box_width
        assert assignments[i].y + items[i].height <= box_height

ensure_item_assignment_validity(item_box_assignments, ITEMS, BOX_WIDTH, BOX_HEIGHT)

problem_description:
Global problem:
    This problem involves a collection of items, where each have a value and a weight. We have different items given in the parameters.
    We have a infinite number of boxes with width BOX_WIDTH and height BOX_HEIGHT. All items need to be packed into minimal number of such boxes.
    The result and expected output is:
        - the assigment of each item into a box
        - the position (x and y) of each item within its assigned box. x and y have minimum values 0 and maximum infinity.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 1:
    The items that are put into a box, must fit exactly inside the box and must not stick out of the box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 2:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, they must not overlap.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 3:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, one item can be exactly in one box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

constants.description: List of items to be placed in the box

decision_variables.description: Number of boxes used to pack all items, to be minimized
Assignment of each item to a box with its position
X and Y positions of each item within their assigned box

    items: DSList(length=10, elem_type=Item),

    box_width: int,
    box_height: int
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        # Ensure item dimensions fit within the box dimensions
        assert assignments[i].x + items[i].width <= box_width
        assert assignments[i].y + items[i].height <= box_height
        # Ensure positions are within valid bounds
        assert assignments[i].x >= 0
        assert assignments[i].y >= 0
        assert assignments[i].box_id >= 1

items_fit_exactly_in_boxes(ITEMS, item_box_assignments, BOX_WIDTH, BOX_HEIGHT)

    items: DSList(length=10, elem_type=Item),
    assignments: DSList(length=10, elem_type=BoxAssignment),
    box_width: int,
    box_height: int
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            # Only check overlap if both items are in the same box
            if assignments[i].box_id == assignments[j].box_id:
                # Check for non-overlapping rectangles
                assert (
                    assignments[i].x + items[i].width <= assignments[j].x or
                    assignments[j].x + items[j].width <= assignments[i].x or
                    assignments[i].y + items[i].height <= assignments[j].y or
                    assignments[j].y + items[j].height <= assignments[i].y
                )

full_formulation:
# --- Objects ---
Item = DSRecord({
    "width": DSInt(lb=1, ub=20),
    "height": DSInt(lb=1, ub=5)
})

BoxAssignment = DSRecord({
    "box_id": DSInt(lb=1, ub=10),
    "x": DSInt(lb=0, ub=20),
    "y": DSInt(lb=0, ub=5)
})



# --- Constants and Decision Variables ---
BOX_HEIGHT : int = 5
BOX_WIDTH : int = 20
ITEMS : DSList(length=10, elem_type=Item) = [{"width": 6, "height": 5}, {"width": 8, "height": 5}, {"width": 6, "height": 3}, {"width": 13, "height": 5}, {"width": 14, "height": 2}, {"width": 12, "height": 4}, {"width": 17, "height": 5}, {"width": 9, "height": 4}, {"width": 16, "height": 3}, {"width": 11, "height": 3}]
N_ITEMS : int = 10
nr_used_boxes: DSInt(lb=0, ub=10)
item_box_assignments: DSList(length=10, elem_type=BoxAssignment)
x_y_positions: DSList(length=10, elem_type=BoxAssignment)
N_ITEMS : int = 10
N_ITEM_BOX_ASSIGNMENTS : int = 10
N_X_Y_POSITIONS : int = 10


# --- objective ---
def calculate_objective(assignments: DSList(length=10, elem_type=BoxAssignment)) -> DSInt(lb=0, ub=10):
    max_box_id: int = 0
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        if assignments[i].box_id > max_box_id:
            max_box_id = assignments[i].box_id
    return max_box_id

objective = calculate_objective(item_box_assignments)
nr_used_boxes = objective
minimize(objective)
